result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles T Furlow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles T Furlow is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charles T Furlow was found guilty of Aggravated Battery-Physically Disabled [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SF unless approved in writing by agent.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward anyone. Def shall not be in 1000 blk of Moorland Rd without written permission of agent.
Continue with mental health treatment. Take all medications as prescribed.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: for Treatment (Incompetency); The Court Orders: These proceedings are suspended. The defendant is committed on 11/12/15 to DHS for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.

Defendant Charles T Furlow in court with attorney Cynthia J. Fiene. Prosecuting Atty Andrea Beth Raymond for Diane Schlipper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Dr. Erik Knudson, duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA. Cross Exam by Atty Fiene. Argument by ADA. Argument by Atty Fiene. Rebuttal by ADA. CT makes findings of incompetency and likelihood of restoration. Pre-commitment incarceration credit to be determined. CT orders proceedings suspended and orders Defn commited to DHS.

Defendant Charles T Furlow in court with attorney Cynthia J. Fiene. Prosecuting Atty Andrea Beth Raymond for Diane Schlipper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Issue of competency is contested. CT was unable to reach doctors. CT finds good cause to set over and scheduled for 11/12/15 at 10:00am.
